0.title: Account and Site Management
0.content: How to request new accounts, modify existing accounts, or request changes to your site and organization information.

1.title: Manage ECE Reporter accounts
1.content: Request a new account . Accounts and account permissions were generated from responses to the Data Managers survey that was circulated to the organization main points of contact. If you would like to request an account for yourself or someone else at your organization: [Needs help link.] . Once we receive the request, we will verify with the organization main point of contact that the person indicated should have an account. Once we have verified that information, an account will be created. The new account information will be shared with that person, including instructions to set a password and log into ECE Reporter. This process can take between 5-10 business days, depending on the verification process. We will send an initial email confirming the receipt of the request and provide updates as we have them! . Reset your password . Modify an existing account .

2.title: Manage program, site and funding info
2.content: Request a change to your program information . Request a change to your site information .

5.title: Gather all required information
5.content: As a reminder, OEC requires that each enrollment record entered in ECE Reporter has the data elements listed on the data requirements page. Make sure to gather all this information before getting started, as you cannot add incomplete records in ECE Reporter.

6.title: Find the “add a record” button on your roster
6.content: . | Click the Roster link in the top left of ECE Reporter, in the menu below the logo. | From your roster, find the Add a record button in the actions section. | Click on the add a record button to begin adding a new child enrollment record. | .

7.title: Enter child data in each section
7.content: ECE Reporter asks for child information in 5 sections: . | Child identifiers | Child info | Family address | Family income | Enrollment and funding | .

8.title: Finishing adding the record
8.content: You’ll return to your roster and see the following confirmation message.

9.title: Find the record in your roster
9.content: If you need to make changes, you can find the child’s record in your roster.

12.title: Table of contents
12.content: . | Initial data collection period | Initial data submission deadline | Enrollments to include | Keep data up-to-date | Review the data requirements | .

13.title: Initial data collection period
13.content: The data collection period begins July 1, 2020 and continues through December 31, 2020.

14.title: Initial data submission deadline
14.content: You must submit your data to OEC by 03/05/2021.

15.title: Enrollments to include
15.content: Children receiving funding through the following programs: . | Child Day Care | Competitive School Readiness | Priority School Readiness | State Head Start | Smart Start | .

16.title: Keep data up-to-date
16.content: After entering your July to December data, OEC requires that ECE Reporter be kept up-to-date. Enter your latest enrollment data at least monthly in ECE Reporter.

17.title: Review the data requirements
17.content: You can find the latest definitions, rationale and accepted formats for every field collected in ECE Reporter on the data definition page in ECE Reporter. View the data requirements .

18.title: How to delete a child’s record
18.content: Use this feature when you’ve mistakenly added a child record to ECE Reporter. Want to withdraw a record instead? See how to withdraw records .

19.title: Navigate to your roster
19.content: Click the Roster link in the top left of ECE Reporter, in the menu below the logo.

20.title: Find the record to be deleted from your roster
20.content: When you find the record you’d like to delete, click on the child’s name to open their enrollment record.

21.title: Delete the child record
21.content: Find and click the delete link in the top-right section of the child’s record. Note: Deleting a record will permanently remove all data.

23.title: Edit a child’s enrollment and funding information

24.title: Table of contents
24.content: . | Find the record to be edited | Make enrollment changes . | Change a child’s age group and or site | Start new or change funding | End funding | Edit or delete enrollment or funding information | . | .

25.title: Find the record to be edited
25.content: . | Navigate to your ECE Reporter roster | When you find the record you’d like to edit, click on the child’s name to open their enrollment record. | Click on the Enrollment and funding tab below the child’s name near the top of the page. | .

26.title: Make enrollment changes
26.content: . Change a child’s age group and or site . Find and click the change enrollment in the top right of the enrollment and funding section. For the new enrollment, add: . | Enrollment site | Enrollment start date | Care model | Age group | Funding source | Contract space | First reporting period (for the new enrollment’s funding) | Last reporting period (for the previous enrollment’s funding) | . Click the change enrollment button. The new enrollment will be displayed in the current enrollment section. The previous enrollment will be saved in the past enrollment section at the bottom of the page. Start new or change funding . If you’ve started or changed the funding source for a child’s enrollment, click the start new funding button at the bottom right of the current enrollment information. For the new changed funding, add: . | Funding type | Contract space | First reporting period | Last reporting period for the previous funding | . Both fundings can be found in the current enrollment section. End funding . Use this when a child is no longer receiving OEC funding for their enrollment. Find and click the end current funding button in the bottom right of the enrollment and funding information card. Add the last reporting period for the current funding and click the end current funding button. The funding will now have an end date in the enrollment information card. Edit or delete enrollment or funding information . Use this if you want to alter incorrect data in an enrollment or funding. Find and click the edit or delete button on the right side of an enrollment or funding. Note: deleting an enrollment will delete all the funding information it contains. The site and age group fields cannot be edited without creating a new enrollment. Make your changes then hit the save button to update the record.

28.title: Edit or update family income determinations

29.title: Table of contents
29.content: . | Navigate to your roster | Redetermine family income | Edit or delete family income information | . Use these instructions when you need to correct or redetermine family income information.

30.title: Navigate to your roster
30.content: . | Click the Roster link in the top left of ECE Reporter, in the menu below the logo. | Find the record to be edited in your roster. | When you find the record you’d like to edit, click on the child’s name to open their enrollment record. | . | Click on the Family income tab below the child’s name near the top of the page. | .

31.title: Redetermine family income
31.content: If you’d like to add a new income determination, click the redetermine link next to the current income determination label. | Enter the new income information and click Save at the bottom of the form. | You will see the new income determination in the current income determination section. | The past income determination will be displayed below in the past income determination section. | .

32.title: Edit or delete family income information
32.content: To correct or delete an income determination: . | Click the edit or delete button on the right side of an income determination. | Make your edits, then click save to update the income determination. | .

34.title: Tips for formatting data
34.content: This page collects Microsoft Excel resources that may be useful if you need to format your data to match OEC’s data template: . | Format a date the way you want it | Split data in a cell | Finding and replacing text | Find more excel help here | Note: If your export removes the leading 0 from zipcodes, don’t worry, ECE Reporter considers that an acceptable format for zipcodes! | .

38.content: . December to July data collection guide . A step by step guide to prepare for OEC’s December to July data collection request. Guide - Prepare your data . Account and site management . How to request new accounts, modify existing accounts, or request changes to your site and organization information. Account and site management . Data requirements . Find the Office of Early Childhood’s requirements for ECE Reporter. Includes which enrollments to enter, where to find data requirements and data collection timelines. Data requirements . Working with child records . See how to add, edit, delete and withdraw child records. Includes how to add income determinations, as well as how change enrollment and funding information. Working with child records . Using your roster . See how to find child records, see withdrawn enrollments and view rosters for previous months. Using your roster .

39.title: Need more support?
39.content: Contact the ECE Reporter team through this form. Get in touch .

44.doc: Guide – July to December data collection
44.title: Guide: How to prepare your July to December data
44.content: Everything you need to meet OEC’s July to December data collection request.

45.doc: Guide – July to December data collection
45.title: Table of contents
45.content: . | Review the data collection basics . | Data collection period | Data submission deadline | Enrollments to include | . | Review the data requirements | Decide your method of data entry | Download the latest data upload template | Export or gather data from your system of record | Enter your data in OEC’s template . | Here’s what a completed record without any enrollment or funding changes will look like: | Add enrollments that have changed . | Example record: Change to site | Example record: Changed to funding source and/or space type | Example record: Changed age group | . | Add enrollments that have been withdrawn . | Example record: Withdrawn | . | . | Upload your data to ECE Reporter | Verify your data | .

46.doc: Guide – July to December data collection
46.title: Review the data collection basics
46.content: Data collection period . The data collection period begins July 1, 2020 and continues through December 31, 2020. Data submission deadline . You must submit your data to OEC by 03/05/2021. Enrollments to include . Children receiving funding through the following programs: . | Child Day Care | Competitive School Readiness | Priority School Readiness | State Head Start | Smart Start | .

47.doc: Guide – July to December data collection
47.title: Review the data requirements
47.content: You can find the latest definitions, rationale and accepted formats for every field collected in ECE Reporter on the data definition page in ECE Reporter. View the data requirements .

48.doc: Guide – July to December data collection
48.title: Decide your method of data entry
48.content: ECE Reporter supports two methods: . | Enter data in OEC’s template and upload all your enrollments at once. See the rest of this guide for instructions. | Enter enrollment records one at a time. See working with child records for more guidance. | .

49.doc: Guide – July to December data collection
49.title: Download the latest data upload template
49.content: ECE Reporter will only accept data in the latest template file format. You can download the template in ECE Reporter. Download the latest template .

50.doc: Guide – July to December data collection
50.title: Export or gather data from your system of record
50.content: Your program may have the data ECE Reporter is requesting in a system of record such as ChildPlus or Powerschool. If you have IT support, they may be able to work with you to create a report from your system of record with the data OEC requires. This can help avoid double data entry.

51.doc: Guide – July to December data collection
51.title: Enter your data in OEC’s template
51.content: Once you’ve read through the data requirements and gathered your enrollment data, it’s time to enter it into OEC’s data template. | Add all the enrollment data you manage to OEC’s data template. You cannot use any other file to upload data to ECE Reporter. | If you upload a file to ECE Reporter, you will erase any data for the sites you’re uploading data to. | To keep things simple, make sure your data is as close to done as possible before uploading. | ECE Reporter will check your data and prompt you to resolve any errors. | If you need to make small updates, don’t worry! All of the data can be edited in the ECE Reporter tool. | . See tips for formatting data for resources that may help you get your data into the format accepted by OEC. Here’s what a completed record without any enrollment or funding changes will look like: . Add enrollments that have changed . Since the Office of Early Childhood is requesting data from 07/01/2020 to 12/31/2020, you’ll need to record enrollment and funding changes. This section will show you how to add those historical updates to OEC’s data template. Here are the enrollment changes you’ll need to record: . | Changes to enrolled site | Changes to age group | Changes to funding types | . To add these changes: . | Create a row with the most recent enrollment data for the child | Fill in all required fields in that row | Create another row for the child’s past enrollment(s) | Make sure all of the fields in the child identifiers section match in every row referring to the same child | In the new enrollment history row, add the previous enrollment and funding info to indicate the changes | All other fields can be blank for the enrollment history row | . See the examples below for a child enrollment that has had changes between July 1, 2020, to December 31, 2020. Example record: Change to site . Example record: Changed to funding source and/or space type . Example record: Changed age group . Add enrollments that have been withdrawn . You’ll need to upload any enrollment that has withdrawn between July 1, 2020, and December 31, 2020. The example below shows what a withdrawn record looks like in OEC’s template. Example record: Withdrawn .

52.doc: Guide – July to December data collection
52.title: Upload your data to ECE Reporter
52.content: . Once all of your data is entered into the ECE Reporter data template format, you’re ready to upload! . To find the file upload page in ECE Reporter: . | Go to https://ece-reporter.ctoec.org/ | Sign in with your account information | Find and click the file upload link in the navigation bars | Choose your completed data template to upload | Verify which sites you’re uploading data for | Your file will be uploaded and checked for any errors | You will see your roster with all of your records uploaded | .

53.doc: Guide – July to December data collection
53.title: Verify your data
53.content: See the verify your data page for ways to make sure your data was entered correctly in ECE Reporter.

54.doc: Guide – July to December data collection
54.title: Guide – July to December data collection

55.doc: Guide – Check your data for accuracy
55.title: Check ECE Reporter data for accuracy

56.doc: Guide – Check your data for accuracy
56.title: Table of contents
56.content: . | Total enrollment numbers | Number of withdrawn enrollments | Accurate child records | Complete enrollment changes | . Total enrollment numbers . You can view total enrollments for your program and each individual site. Number of withdrawn enrollments . Click the “withdrawn records” button on your roster to view all withdrawn records. Check that the total number of withdrawn records is accurate. Accurate child records . Click any child’s name on your roster to view their record. Check to make sure all information is accurate. Complete enrollment changes . If you uploaded any enrollment changes to a child’s record, make sure they appear in the enrollment and funding section.

57.doc: Guide – Check your data for accuracy
57.title: Guide – Check your data for accuracy

58.title: Withdraw a child’s record
58.content: Want to change an enrollment’s site, age group and/or funding instead? See how to change enrollments .

59.title: Open the record and find the “withdraw” button

60.title: Add required fields, and confirm the withdrawal

61.title: Find the record in your withdrawn roster view

63.title: Working with child records
63.content: Use this feature when you need to edit or make updates to a child’s record.

64.title: Navigate to your roster
64.content: Click the Roster link in the top left of ECE Reporter, in the menu below the logo.

65.title: Find the record to be edited in your roster
65.content: When you find the record you’d like to edit, click on the child’s name to open their enrollment record.

66.title: Find the section that has the information you’d like to edit
66.content: The information entered about a child is organized into these sections: . | Child identifiers - Includes name, ID #, date of birth, and birth certificate information. | Child information - Includes race, ethnicity, gender, dual language status, disability service status, and foster family status. | Family information - Includes address and homelessness status. | Family income determination - Includes household size, annual income, and redetermination date. See more | Enrollment and Funding - Includes provider, site, care model, age group, enrollment dates, funding type, space type, and funding reporting periods. See more | .

67.title: Make edits and save your changes

69.title: Table of contents
69.content: . | Roster basics | View withdrawn records | View a roster from a past month | Incomplete enrollments | .

70.title: Roster basics
70.content: . | Every child with a currently active enrollment will display under the age group section that applies to them. | You can sort your roster by each column. | For example, sort by the birthdate column to see records from oldest to youngest. | . | .

71.title: View withdrawn records
71.content: . | Find and click the withdrawn records button. | The withdrawn roster view shows all withdrawn records sorted by most recent withdrawal date. | Click “back” or “return to current roster” to view your active enrollments. | .

72.title: View a roster from a past month
72.content: . | Use this when you’d like to see your state-funded enrollments for a different month. | Find and click the “view roster for a past month button”. [need to update copy in app] . | Choose the month you’d like to view. You cannot view a month in the future or before July 2020. | You’ll be taken to a roster that shows enrollments for the month you chose. | Click “back” or “return to current roster” to view your active enrollments | .

73.title: Incomplete enrollments
73.content: . | The incomplete enrollment section appears when you have records with key enrollment data missing. | These records may be created when you upload incomplete data or leaving the page while adding a child record | . | Once you add the missing enrollment data to these records, they will be moved to the correct age group. | If the record was added by mistake, See how to delete records | .
